title: Operation Red Card
text:
Operation Red Card is the name given to a two-month Asia-wide <a href="copyright%20infringement">anti-piracy</a> operation that was conducted by the Motion Picture Association (MPA) (the international arm of the <a href="Motion%20Picture%20Association%20of%20America">Motion Picture Association of America</a>) which resulted in the seizure of 6.7 million pirated discs in 12 countries across the <a href="Asia-Pacific">Asia-Pacific</a> region. The operation took place between May to mid-July 2006, resulting in 915 arrests and the seizure of 1,483 optical disc burners.
There were 1,919 raids conducted in 12 countries throughout Asia. 
The MPAA has been conducting anti-piracy sweeps on a twice a year basis, with more than 2,500 arrests and the seizure of over 23 million illegal videos so far.
According to the MPAA, its members—which encompass all of the major film studios in Hollywood—lost $1.2 billion a year in revenue due to piracy and illegal downloading.
The name "Operation Red Card" is a reference to the red card issued by a referee to a player ejected from a <a href="association%20football">football</a> game for unsportsmanlike conduct or repeated <a href="Foul%20%28football%29">fouls</a>.
